description: An alternate universe version of feudal Japan featured in the Boss Luffy Historical Special episodes. A land where the One Piece characters exist in different roles within an Edo period setting.

keyEvents.title: Mikoshi Race Takes Place
keyEvents.description: The town hosts the grand mikoshi race, a festival event that occurs once every 100 years with a grand prize.
keyEvents.significance: The mikoshi race is the central event of this episode, showcasing the festival culture of Grand Jipangu.

statusHistory.reason: Alternate universe setting for Boss Luffy Historical episodes

description: A restaurant in Grand Jipangu co-owned by Onami and Sanji. It serves as the base of operations for Boss Luffy and his friends in the Boss Luffy Historical Special.

keyEvents.title: Robin Reveals Brook's Past
keyEvents.description: At the Pinwheel Eatery, Robin tells the crew about Brook's history with Thriller Company.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the crew learns about Brook's situation and decides to help him.

keyEvents.title: Crew Decides to Help Brook
keyEvents.description: The crew at the Pinwheel Eatery commits to helping Brook and entering the mikoshi race.
keyEvents.significance: The decision that drives the episode's plot is made at this location.
